metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3565 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
snmplib/mib.c in net-snmp 5.7.0 and earlier, when the -OQ option is used, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (snmptrapd crash) via a crafted SNMP trap message, which triggers a conversion to the variable type designated in the MIB file, as demonstrated by a NULL type in an ifMtu trap message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3565` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
libsnmp30 - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
python-netsnmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
snmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
snmpd - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
tkmib - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> per upstream, -OQ option is uncommon

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.1').
